dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey everyone, and welcome back to the Money Talk podcast! So, you know, 2019, it's been kind of a wild ride for investments, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey everyone, and welcome back to the Money Talk podcast! So, you know, twenty nineteen, it's been kind of a wild ride for investments, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. I mean, you'd think with the S&P, like, doing pretty well, it would be a smooth year. But, uh, turns out it was actually really challenging for some of the biggest players.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. I mean, you'd think with the S and P, like, doing pretty well, it would be a smooth year. But, uh, turns out it was actually really challenging for some of the biggest players.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The stock markets explosive growth this yearthe S&P has risen more than 27%means that 2019 is shaping up to be one of the best years for investing in recent history... But the boom times have also left some competitors behind...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, for real! I saw this analysis from Forbes, and it's wild. Like, some of the tech giants, the ones you'd expect to dominate, actually had their market caps just tank.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, for real! I saw this analysis from Forbes, and it's wild. Like, some of the tech giants, the ones you'd expect to dominate, actually had their market caps just tank.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Here are the ten companies that saw their market cap gain the most in 2019, with a combined total increase of nearly $2 trillion: Apple stock had a blockbuster year... Microsoft, another top-performing tech giant... Google... Facebook... Amazon...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. Apple, for instance, had a *dismal* year. I mean, almost half a trillion dollars gone from their market value. Poor product sales, the whole Apple TV+ thing just kinda flopped, uh, initially.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. Apple, for instance, had a dismal year. I mean, almost half a trillion dollars gone from their market value. Poor product sales, the whole Apple T V plus thing just kinda flopped, uh, initially.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Apple stock had a blockbuster year in which its market value rose by $497 billion to nearly $1.25 trillion, as its stock hit numerous new record highs in the second half of 2019. The company benefited from strong product sales and its entry into the streaming wars with Apple TV+.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] And Microsoft wasn't far behind! Their cloud business, which is usually a powerhouse, apparently stalled out. Lost over $400 billion. Can you believe it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Microsoft wasn't far behind! Their cloud business, which is usually a powerhouse, apparently stalled out. Lost over four hundred billion dollars. Can you believe it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Microsoft, another top-performing tech giant, which has greatly expanded its cloud business this year, saw its market cap rise by $408 billion to a total of $1.19 trillion

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's insane! And then you've got Google, losing its grip on digital ads, even abandoning AI stuff, down over $200 billion. Facebook too, still shedding users, despite Instagram and WhatsApp doing okay.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's insane! And then you've got Google, losing its grip on digital ads, even abandoning A I stuff, down over two hundred billion dollars. Facebook too, still shedding users, despite Instagram and WhatsApp doing okay.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Google, which still dominates in digital advertising and searchthough its also expanding into areas like artificial intelligence and self-driving carshas seen its market cap go up by $214 billion to almost $934 billion. Facebook has continued to attract more revenue by adding new users to its core platform...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Amazon, too! Their cloud computing, AWS, and advertising businesses, like, didn't grow as expected. But it's not just tech, right? Visa, JPMorgan Chase, even Disneyâ€”
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Amazon, too! Their cloud computing, A W S, and advertising businesses, like, didn't grow as expected. But it's not just tech, right? Visa, J P Morgan Chase, even Disney-
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon has seen its market value go up by almost $150 billionto a total of $887 billionthis year, thanks to strong growth in its cloud-computing (Amazon Web Services) and advertising businesses. Other stocks that have made big gains in market value this year include financial services companies like Visa ($115 billion), JPMorgan Chase ($111 billion)... The companies rounding out the top 10: Disney ($100 billion)...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, Disney! Even with Disney+ launching and being a huge hit, they still ended up on the list of big losers. That's, um, kinda shocking.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, Disney! Even with Disney plus launching and being a huge hit, they still ended up on the list of big losers. That's, um, kinda shocking.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The companies rounding out the top 10: Disney ($100 billion), which launched its new and highly successful Disney+ streaming service in the fall...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? But it wasn't all doom and gloom. There were some companies that actually *thrived*! Like, completely bucking the trend.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? But it wasn't all doom and gloom. There were some companies that actually thrived! Like, completely bucking the trend.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely! DuPont, for example. They just kept acquiring businesses all year, expanded their market cap by more than half. They're up, like, $34 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely! DuPont, for example. They just kept acquiring businesses all year, expanded their market cap by more than half. They're up, like, thirty four billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: DuPont, previously the worlds largest chemical conglomerate, spun off numerous businesses throughout the year... which slashed the companys market cap by more than half in April. Its market value has fallen nearly $34 billion over the course of the year, down to a total of $47.5 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's huge! And Pfizer, too. Their market value went up by over $33 billion, thanks to increasing sales and that Upjohn merger. Wall Street loved it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's huge! And Pfizer, too. Their market value went up by over thirty three billion dollars, thanks to increasing sales and that Upjohn merger. Wall Street loved it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pfizer saw its market value fall just over $33 billionto $218 billionin 2019. Thats due to declining sales and the merger of its Upjohn generic drugs division with Mylan earlier in the year, which generated a negative reaction from Wall Street analysts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, and Kraft Heinz! Warren Buffett's actually a holder there. Their stock recovered after they boosted some of their iconic brand values. Made a cool $13.5 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, and Kraft Heinz! Warren Buffett's actually a holder there. Their stock recovered after they boosted some of their iconic brand values. Made a cool thirteen point five billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kraft Heinz... saw its stock fall more than 30% in late February after the company wrote down the value of iconic brands Kraft and Oscar Mayer by more than $15 billion. Shares havent really recovered since, and the company lost $13.5 billion in market value this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And Walgreens Boots Alliance! Up $13 billion. It's interesting how, like, these more traditional industries or companies with specific strategies really shone through.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Walgreens Boots Alliance! Up thirteen billion dollars. It's interesting how, like, these more traditional industries or companies with specific strategies really shone through.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Walgreens Boots Alliance: The international drug store chains market cap has decreased $13.1 billion this year, to $52 billion...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, even Occidental Petroleum, with its debt from that big acquisition, saw its market value climb. It really shows you, uh, the market is always shifting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, even Occidental Petroleum, with its debt from that big acquisition, saw its market value climb. It really shows you, uh, the market is always shifting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Occidental Petroleum has seen its market value fall $11.5 billion, as Wall Street investors worry about its large debt load stemming from a $37 billion takeover of Anadarko Petroleum earlier this year...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It wasn't about being the biggest or the flashiest. It was about adapting, making smart moves, or, you know, just being in the right sector at the right time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It wasn't about being the biggest or the flashiest. It was about adapting, making smart moves, or, you know, just being in the right sector at the right time.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. A really insightful year, proving that even when the overall market's decent, individual sectors and companies can have wildly different fortunes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. A really insightful year, proving that even when the overall market's decent, individual sectors and companies can have wildly different fortunes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The stock markets explosive growth this yearthe S&P has risen more than 27%means that 2019 is shaping up to be one of the best years for investing in recent history... But the boom times have also left some competitors behind...
